subject: Ethics
title: The Speciesism Debate
description: A fast breakdown of The Speciesism Debate for builders.

hook.text: We test shampoo on rabbits' eyes but would never do it to a human infant. Why is one okay and not the other?

buildup.text: Speciesism is the idea that favoring humans just because they're human is an unjustified bias.

discovery.text: Peter Singer coined the term, comparing it to racism: both discriminate based on morally irrelevant traits.

twist.text: Critics argue species membership does matterâ€”humans have unique capacities like moral reasoning and culture.

climax.text: The debate isn't settled. But 'because they're not human' is no longer an acceptable answer on its own.

punchline.text: If species alone justifies harm, what else might it justify?

quiz.question: What does the concept of speciesism claim?
options: Humans are biologically superior to all other species
Different species should live in separate ecosystems
Favoring humans simply because they are human is an unjustified moral bias
